headline: Caterpillar’s Surging Stock Is Fueled by AI, Not Yellow Excavators
summary: An ambitious data-center project in Utah is going to need about one-quarter of the juice the entire state currently uses.  David Gray, co-chief executive for the project’s developer, knows he can’t get it from the electric grid.  “Our electric grid is constrained in many areas, so we’re trying to build power generation on site,” said Gray, whose firm Joule Capital Partners plans to build six data centers for the growing artificial-intelligence server market.
